# The new stone furnace is now operational and has 4 units of iron ore ready for smelting. However, the first furnace is currently idle with no ingredients to smelt, which means it has finished processing its materials.

# To optimize production, I should consider transferring some of the iron plates from the first furnace to the second furnace, or I could also use the first furnace for smelting other materials if I have them.

# Since I currently have 1 iron plate in my inventory, I can keep the first furnace idle for now or consider crafting other items that may require iron plates.

# To continue with production, I will monitor the new furnace as it processes the iron ore into iron plates. 
# I will wait for the smelting process to complete and check how many iron plates are produced.

# Using a sleep loop for a maximum wait time to check the status of the new furnace.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait
    if inspect_inventory(new_furnace)[Prototype.IronPlate] > 0:  # Check if any plates have been produced
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")

# Once the plates are ready, I can extract them.
crafted_plates_new_furnace = extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, new_furnace.position, quantity=5)  # Extract the iron plates
print(f"Extracted Iron Plates from new furnace: {crafted_plates_new_furnace}")
print(f"Final New Furnace status: {inspect_inventory(new_furnace)}")  # Check the new furnace status after extraction
print(f"Final Inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Confirm total iron plates in the inventory
